activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey S Beaugrand

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant Jeffrey S Beaugrand in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Jeffrey S Beaugrand.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper asks for an adjournment of the preliminary hearing due to just give the defense counsel an offer. Attorney Dadoun heard and speaks about an OWI 1st  case. Court speaks about the OWI first and will not appoint Attorney Dadoun on the 22TR680.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:11 PM Defendant Jeffrey S Beaugrand in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Jeffrey S Beaugrand. Attorney Dadoun states that JB is looking at a treatment program in Dane County and asks for a reset. Attorney Dadoun waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

While the case is pending, Defendant to pay $100/month to the Clerk of Court, first payment due 07/18/22. At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk.

8:59 AM Defendant Jeffrey S Beaugrand in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court asks about counsel. JB has spoken with the public defenders office and notes that he has been trying to get an attorney. Defendant provides the application for dean appointment. Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Dadoun. Defendant to deposit $100/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 07/18/22 weekly . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court. Defendant waives the time limits of the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:32 PM  Defendant Jeffrey S Beaugrand in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. JB has received the complaint. Court reads the complaint. Defendant speak about calling the public defender for another  case. Court advise the defendant  to call the public defender office about this case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Forehand appears for the state.Defendant appearing in custody, in person. Attorney Forehand asks for a $1,000 signature bond with the condition not to operate a motor vehicle unless licensed. No objection from the defendant. So ordered. Initial appearance set for 06/29/22 at 1:30
